biography:
Richard Melville Hall (born September 11, 1965), better known by his stage name Moby, is an American singer-songwriter, musician, DJ and photographer. He is well known for his electronic music, vegan lifestyle, and support of animal rights. Moby has sold over 20 million albums worldwide.  AllMusic considers him "one of the most important dance music figures of the early 1990s, helping bring the music to a mainstream audience both in the UK and in America".
Moby gained attention in the early 1990s with his electronic dance music work, which experimented in the techno and breakbeat hardcore genres. With his fifth studio album, the electronica and house music-influenced Play, he gained international success. Originally released in mid-1999, the album sold 6,000 copies in its first week, and it re-entered the charts in early 2000 and became an unexpected hit, producing eight singles and selling over 10 million copies worldwide. Moby followed the album in 2002 with 18, which was also successful, selling over 5 million copies worldwide and receiving mostly positive reviews, though some criticized it for being too similar to Play.
His next major release, 2005's mostly upbeat Hotel was a stylistic departure, incorporating more alternative rock elements than previous albums, and received mixed reviews. It sold around 2 million copies worldwide. After 2008's dance-influenced Last Night (2008), he returned to the downtempo electronica of Play and 18 with 2009's mostly-ambient Wait for Me, finding higher critical acclaim and moderate sales, as well as 2011's Destroyed. Moby's latest album, Innocents, was released on October 1, 2013.
Moby has also co-written, produced, and remixed music for Michael Jackson, David Bowie, Daft Punk, Myl√®ne Farmer, Brian Eno, Pet Shop Boys, Britney Spears, New Order, Public Enemy, Guns N' Roses, Metallica, Soundgarden, and others.
name: Moby

discogs.name: Moby
discogs.profile:
Multi-instrumentalist, singer-songwriter, music producer, and DJ.
Born: September 11, 1965, Harlem, New York, NY, USA. Grew up in Darien, CT, USA. Now lives in Los Angeles, CA, USA.
Founded the labels [l=Little Idiot] & [l=Always Centered At Night].

raw_data.lastfm: ArtistLastFmData(name='Moby', url='https://www.last.fm/music/Moby', mbid='8970d868-0723-483b-a75b-51088913d3d4', listeners=3245799, playcount=117640717, bio_summary='Richard Melville Hall (born September 11, 1965), known professionally as Moby, is an American musician, songwriter, singer, producer, and animal rights activist. He has sold 20 million records worldwide. AllMusic considers him to be "among the most important dance music figures of the early 1990s, helping bring dance music to a mainstream audience both in the United States and the United Kingdom." After taking up guitar and piano at age nine, he played Read more on Last.fm', bio_content='Richard Melville Hall (born September 11, 1965), known professionally as Moby, is an American musician, songwriter, singer, producer, and animal rights activist. He has sold 20 million records worldwide. AllMusic considers him to be "among the most important dance music figures of the early 1990s, helping bring dance music to a mainstream audience both in the United States and the United Kingdom." After taking up guitar and piano at age nine, he played in several underground punk rock bands through the 1980s before turning to electronic dance music. In 1989, he moved to New York City and became a prolific figure as a DJ, producer, and remixer. His 1991 single "Go" was his mainstream breakthrough, especially in Europe, where it peaked within the top ten of the charts in the Netherlands and the United Kingdom. Between 1992 and 1997, he scored eight top 10 hits on the Billboard Dance Club Songs chart including "Move (You Make Me Feel So Good)", "Feeling So Real", and "James Bond Theme (Moby Re-Version)". Throughout the decade, he also produced music under various pseudonyms, released the critically acclaimed Everything Is Wrong (1995), and composed music for films. His punk-oriented album Animal Rights (1996) alienated much of his fan base. Moby found commercial and critical success with his fifth album Play (1999), which, after receiving little recognition, became an unexpected global hit in 2000 after each track was licensed to films, television shows, and commercials. It remains his highest selling album with 12 million copies sold. Its seventh single, "South Side", featuring Gwen Stefani, remains his only one to appear on the US Billboard Hot 100, reaching No. 14. Moby followed Play with albums of varied styles including electronic, dance, rock, and downtempo music, starting with 18 (2002), Hotel (2005), and Last Night (2008). His later albums saw him explore ambient music, including the almost four-hour release Long Ambients 1: Calm. Sleep. (2016). Moby continues to record and release albums; his twenty-first studio album, Resound NYC, was released in May 2023. In addition to his music career, Moby is known for his veganism and support for animal rights and humanitarian aid. He was the owner of TeaNY, a vegan cafe in Manhattan, and Little Pine, a vegan restaurant in Los Angeles, and organized the vegan music and food festival Circle V. He is the author of four books, including a collection of his photography and two memoirs: Porcelain: A Memoir (2016) and Then It Fell Apart (2019). theaudiodb.biography_de:
Moby (* 11. September 1965 in Harlem, New York; b√ºrgerlich Richard Melville Hall) ist ein US-amerikanischer S√§nger, Gitarrist, DJ und Musikproduzent.

Richard Melville Hall wuchs in Darien im Bundesstaat Connecticut auf. Sein Vater starb bei einem Autounfall als Melville zwei Jahre alt war, seine Mutter starb in Melvilles Zwanzigern an Krebs. Abgeleitet vom Roman Moby Dick seines Ur-Ur-Gro√üonkels Herman Melville erhielt er als Kind den Spitznamen Moby. Diesen w√§hlte er sp√§ter auch als K√ºnstlernamen. 

In seiner Schulzeit gr√ºndete er 1982 eine Hardcore-Punk-Band namens Vatican Commandos und war √úbergangss√§nger der Punkband Flipper. Nach Abbruch seines College-Studiums der Religion und Philosophie ging er nach New York, wo er seine ersten Schritte als DJ machte.

1990 erschien Mobys erste Single Time‚Äôs Up, die er zusammen mit Jared Hofmann, dem Gr√ºnder des New Yorker Labels INSTINCT Records, unter dem Namen The Brotherhood produzierte. Der Titel war die erste Ver√∂ffentlichung des neu gegr√ºndeten Labels, auf dem sp√§ter Musiker wie DJ Cam, Kruder & Dorfmeister und Marianne Faithfull ver√∂ffentlichten. Die Single erschien au√üerdem in einer kleinen Auflage beim deutschen Plattenlabel Low Spirit. 

Sein Track Go (Woodtick Mix) (meist nur als Go bekannt, wobei dies eine v√∂llig andere Version ist, die bereits 1990 auf der EP Mobility ver√∂ffentlicht wurde) wurde im Sommer 1991 ein Top-Ten-Hit in den britischen Charts. In den USA zog der Titel im Fr√ºhjahr 1992 in die Top 20 der Dance-Charts ein. Die nachgespielte Melodie basiert auf Angelo Badalamentis Laura Palmer‚Äôs Theme aus der Fernsehserie Twin Peaks von Regisseur David Lynch. Anschlie√üend erschien das Deb√ºtalbum Moby, das mit Drop a Beat und Next Is the E zwei weitere Dancehits brachte, die in die Top 10 einzogen. Die UK-Version des Albums enthielt statt Drop a Beat den Titel Thousand. Wegen seiner bis zu 1000 bpm fand er 1993 als bis dahin schnellstes Musikst√ºck Eintrag ins Guinness-Buch der Rekorde.[3] Mit Move (You Make Me Feel so Good) schaffte er es im Oktober 1993 erstmals an die Spitze der US-Dancecharts.

Nach seinen ersten Erfolgen wurde Moby als Remixer f√ºr Michael Jackson, die Pet Shop Boys, Brian Eno, Depeche Mode, Erasure, Orbital und die B-52s engagiert. Zudem rappte er auf dem Recoil-Track Curse. 1995 gr√ºndete er sein eigenes Plattenlabel Trophy Records, bei dem er ausschlie√ülich eigenes Material unter verschiedenen Pseudonymen (Lopez, Voodoo Child, DJ Cake) ver√∂ffentlichte. Der Musikstil der f√ºnf im Zeitraum von 1995 bis 1997 erschienenen Ver√∂ffentlichungen bewegt sich im Hard-House-Genre.

Sein drittes Album Everything Is Wrong ver√∂ffentlichte Moby 1995. Mit dem Song Hymn kam er erstmals in die Schweizer Hitparade, Feeling so Real war auch in √ñsterreich und Deutschland in den Top 20 vertreten. Die LP war in Deutschland und Gro√übritannien in den Albumcharts.

Die folgenden Jahre waren weniger erfolgreich, das von Alternative Rock beeinflusste Album Animal Rights aus dem Jahr 1996 sowie die Kompilation I Like to Score mit Filmtracks ein Jahr sp√§ter blieben hinter den Vorg√§ngern zur√ºck. Lediglich eine ‚ÄûRe-Version‚Äú des James Bond Themes, die auch f√ºr den James-Bond-Film Der Morgen stirbt nie verwendet wurde, wurde ein internationaler Hit, zum zweiten Mal erreichte er damit Platz 1 der US-Dancecharts und die Top Ten der UK-Charts.
theaudiodb.biography_en:
Richard Melville Hall (born September 11, 1965), better known by his stage name Moby, is an American singer-songwriter, musician, DJ and photographer. He is well known for his electronic music, vegan lifestyle, and support of animal rights. Moby has sold over 20 million albums worldwide.  AllMusic considers him "one of the most important dance music figures of the early 1990s, helping bring the music to a mainstream audience both in the UK and in America".
Moby gained attention in the early 1990s with his electronic dance music work, which experimented in the techno and breakbeat hardcore genres. With his fifth studio album, the electronica and house music-influenced Play, he gained international success. Originally released in mid-1999, the album sold 6,000 copies in its first week, and it re-entered the charts in early 2000 and became an unexpected hit, producing eight singles and selling over 10 million copies worldwide. Moby followed the album in 2002 with 18, which was also successful, selling over 5 million copies worldwide and receiving mostly positive reviews, though some criticized it for being too similar to Play.
His next major release, 2005's mostly upbeat Hotel was a stylistic departure, incorporating more alternative rock elements than previous albums, and received mixed reviews. It sold around 2 million copies worldwide. After 2008's dance-influenced Last Night (2008), he returned to the downtempo electronica of Play and 18 with 2009's mostly-ambient Wait for Me, finding higher critical acclaim and moderate sales, as well as 2011's Destroyed. Moby's latest album, Innocents, was released on October 1, 2013.
Moby has also co-written, produced, and remixed music for Michael Jackson, David Bowie, Daft Punk, Myl√®ne Farmer, Brian Eno, Pet Shop Boys, Britney Spears, New Order, Public Enemy, Guns N' Roses, Metallica, Soundgarden, and others.
theaudiodb.biography_es:
Richard Melville Hall (Harlem, Nueva York, 11 de septiembre de 1965), m√°s conocido como Moby, es un compositor de m√∫sica electr√≥nica estadounidense. Tom√≥ su nombre art√≠stico del libro m√°s famoso de su conocido t√≠o bisabuelo, Herman Melville, Moby Dick. Despu√©s de colocar ocho de sus sencillos en la lista de sencillos del Reino Unido en los a√±os 90 haciendo m√∫sica techno, su mayor √©xito fue Play, lanzado en 1999, del cual vendi√≥ 12 millones de copias en todo el mundo.

Ha tenido conflictos dial√©cticos con los cantantes Marilyn Manson y Eminem. Desde 2007 sube m√∫sica a su cuenta de YouTube y cuenta con m√°s de 50 millones de reproducciones Su etapa como solista, cuenta con 12 √°lbumes de estudio, 10 √°lbumes recopilatorios, m√°s de 65 sencillos, entre otras apariciones. A lo largo de su carrera vendi√≥ m√°s de 20 Millones de √Ålbumes y 3 millones solo en Estados Unidos, tiene certificaciones tal como 1 Diamante en Francia, 20 Discos de Platino, 16 Discos de oro y 1 de plata.
theaudiodb.biography_fr:
Moby, de son vrai nom Richard Melville Hall, est un artiste de musique √©lectronique am√©ricain et photographe, n√© le 11 septembre 1965 √† New York dans le quartier de Harlem. Multi-instrumentiste, il chante, joue de la guitare, des claviers, de la basse et des percussions.

L‚Äôartiste aborde, √† travers la musique √©lectronique, une multiplicit√© de genres musicaux o√π il puise son inspiration aussi bien dans la techno, que dans le blues ou le rock. Artiste engag√©, il est un fervent d√©fenseur des droits des animaux.

Avant d‚Äôavoir acquis sa notori√©t√© actuelle, Moby a produit sa musique sous diff√©rents pseudonymes tels que Voodoo Child, Barracuda, UHF, The Brotherhood, Schaumgummi, DJ Cake, Lopez, Brainstorm & Mindstorm ou The Pork Guys. Le DJ am√©ricain est l'une des figures embl√©matiques de la Dance music des ann√©es 1990 dans le monde. Il a vendu plus de 20 millions d'albums √† travers le monde.

raw_data.name: Moby
raw_data.profile:
Multi-instrumentalist, singer-songwriter, music producer, and DJ.
Born: September 11, 1965, Harlem, New York, NY, USA. Grew up in Darien, CT, USA. Now lives in Los Angeles, CA, USA.
Founded the labels [l=Little Idiot] & [l=Always Centered At Night].

lastfm.bio_content: Richard Melville Hall (born September 11, 1965), known professionally as Moby, is an American musician, songwriter, singer, producer, and animal rights activist. He has sold 20 million records worldwide. AllMusic considers him to be "among the most important dance music figures of the early 1990s, helping bring dance music to a mainstream audience both in the United States and the United Kingdom." After taking up guitar and piano at age nine, he played in several underground punk rock bands through the 1980s before turning to electronic dance music. In 1989, he moved to New York City and became a prolific figure as a DJ, producer, and remixer. His 1991 single "Go" was his mainstream breakthrough, especially in Europe, where it peaked within the top ten of the charts in the Netherlands and the United Kingdom. Between 1992 and 1997, he scored eight top 10 hits on the Billboard Dance Club Songs chart including "Move (You Make Me Feel So Good)", "Feeling So Real", and "James Bond Theme (Moby Re-Version)". Throughout the decade, he also produced music under various pseudonyms, released the critically acclaimed Everything Is Wrong (1995), and composed music for films. His punk-oriented album Animal Rights (1996) alienated much of his fan base. Moby found commercial and critical success with his fifth album Play (1999), which, after receiving little recognition, became an unexpected global hit in 2000 after each track was licensed to films, television shows, and commercials. It remains his highest selling album with 12 million copies sold. Its seventh single, "South Side", featuring Gwen Stefani, remains his only one to appear on the US Billboard Hot 100, reaching No. 14. Moby followed Play with albums of varied styles including electronic, dance, rock, and downtempo music, starting with 18 (2002), Hotel (2005), and Last Night (2008). His later albums saw him explore ambient music, including the almost four-hour release Long Ambients 1: Calm. Sleep. (2016). Moby continues to record and release albums; his twenty-first studio album, Resound NYC, was released in May 2023. In addition to his music career, Moby is known for his veganism and support for animal rights and humanitarian aid. He was the owner of TeaNY, a vegan cafe in Manhattan, and Little Pine, a vegan restaurant in Los Angeles, and organized the vegan music and food festival Circle V. He is the author of four books, including a collection of his photography and two memoirs: Porcelain: A Memoir (2016) and Then It Fell Apart (2019). Full Wikipedia article: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moby Discography Moby (1992) Ambient (1993) Everything Is Wrong (1995) Animal Rights (1996) Play (1999) 18 (2002) Hotel (2005) Last Night (2008) Wait for Me (2009) Destroyed (2011) Innocents (2013) Long Ambients 1: Calm. Sleep. (2016) These Systems Are Failing (2016) More Fast Songs About the Apocalypse (2017) Everything Was Beautiful, and Nothing Hurt (2018) Long Ambients 2 (2019) All Visible Objects (2020) Live Ambient Improvised Recordings Vol. 1 (2020) Reprise (2021) Ambient 23 (2023) Resound NYC (2023) Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

theaudiodb.biography_de:
Moby (* 11. September 1965 in Harlem, New York; b√ºrgerlich Richard Melville Hall) ist ein US-amerikanischer S√§nger, Gitarrist, DJ und Musikproduzent.

Richard Melville Hall wuchs in Darien im Bundesstaat Connecticut auf. Sein Vater starb bei einem Autounfall als Melville zwei Jahre alt war, seine Mutter starb in Melvilles Zwanzigern an Krebs. Abgeleitet vom Roman Moby Dick seines Ur-Ur-Gro√üonkels Herman Melville erhielt er als Kind den Spitznamen Moby. Diesen w√§hlte er sp√§ter auch als K√ºnstlernamen. 

In seiner Schulzeit gr√ºndete er 1982 eine Hardcore-Punk-Band namens Vatican Commandos und war √úbergangss√§nger der Punkband Flipper. Nach Abbruch seines College-Studiums der Religion und Philosophie ging er nach New York, wo er seine ersten Schritte als DJ machte.

1990 erschien Mobys erste Single Time‚Äôs Up, die er zusammen mit Jared Hofmann, dem Gr√ºnder des New Yorker Labels INSTINCT Records, unter dem Namen The Brotherhood produzierte. Der Titel war die erste Ver√∂ffentlichung des neu gegr√ºndeten Labels, auf dem sp√§ter Musiker wie DJ Cam, Kruder & Dorfmeister und Marianne Faithfull ver√∂ffentlichten. Die Single erschien au√üerdem in einer kleinen Auflage beim deutschen Plattenlabel Low Spirit. 

Sein Track Go (Woodtick Mix) (meist nur als Go bekannt, wobei dies eine v√∂llig andere Version ist, die bereits 1990 auf der EP Mobility ver√∂ffentlicht wurde) wurde im Sommer 1991 ein Top-Ten-Hit in den britischen Charts. In den USA zog der Titel im Fr√ºhjahr 1992 in die Top 20 der Dance-Charts ein. Die nachgespielte Melodie basiert auf Angelo Badalamentis Laura Palmer‚Äôs Theme aus der Fernsehserie Twin Peaks von Regisseur David Lynch. Anschlie√üend erschien das Deb√ºtalbum Moby, das mit Drop a Beat und Next Is the E zwei weitere Dancehits brachte, die in die Top 10 einzogen. Die UK-Version des Albums enthielt statt Drop a Beat den Titel Thousand. Wegen seiner bis zu 1000 bpm fand er 1993 als bis dahin schnellstes Musikst√ºck Eintrag ins Guinness-Buch der Rekorde.[3] Mit Move (You Make Me Feel so Good) schaffte er es im Oktober 1993 erstmals an die Spitze der US-Dancecharts.

Nach seinen ersten Erfolgen wurde Moby als Remixer f√ºr Michael Jackson, die Pet Shop Boys, Brian Eno, Depeche Mode, Erasure, Orbital und die B-52s engagiert. Zudem rappte er auf dem Recoil-Track Curse. 1995 gr√ºndete er sein eigenes Plattenlabel Trophy Records, bei dem er ausschlie√ülich eigenes Material unter verschiedenen Pseudonymen (Lopez, Voodoo Child, DJ Cake) ver√∂ffentlichte. Der Musikstil der f√ºnf im Zeitraum von 1995 bis 1997 erschienenen Ver√∂ffentlichungen bewegt sich im Hard-House-Genre.

Sein drittes Album Everything Is Wrong ver√∂ffentlichte Moby 1995. Mit dem Song Hymn kam er erstmals in die Schweizer Hitparade, Feeling so Real war auch in √ñsterreich und Deutschland in den Top 20 vertreten. Die LP war in Deutschland und Gro√übritannien in den Albumcharts.

Die folgenden Jahre waren weniger erfolgreich, das von Alternative Rock beeinflusste Album Animal Rights aus dem Jahr 1996 sowie die Kompilation I Like to Score mit Filmtracks ein Jahr sp√§ter blieben hinter den Vorg√§ngern zur√ºck. Lediglich eine ‚ÄûRe-Version‚Äú des James Bond Themes, die auch f√ºr den James-Bond-Film Der Morgen stirbt nie verwendet wurde, wurde ein internationaler Hit, zum zweiten Mal erreichte er damit Platz 1 der US-Dancecharts und die Top Ten der UK-Charts.

–ú–æ–±–∏ (–∞–Ω–≥–ª. Moby, –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–æ—è—â–µ–µ –∏–º—è –†–∏ÃÅ—á–∞—Ä–¥ –ú–µÃÅ–ª–≤–∏–ª–ª –•–æ–ª–ª, –∞–Ω–≥–ª. Richard Melville Hall; 11 —Å–µ–Ω—Ç—è–±—Ä—è 1965, –ì–∞—Ä–ª–µ–º, –ù—å—é-–ô–æ—Ä–∫) ‚Äî –∞–º–µ—Ä–∏–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π –¥–∏–¥–∂–µ–π, –ø–µ–≤–µ—Ü, –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–æ—Ä, –º—É–ª—å—Ç–∏–∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç –∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–∏–π –≤ —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞—Ö ‚Äî –æ—Ç —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –¥–æ –ø–æ–ø-–º—É–∑—ã–∫–∏, —Ä–æ–∫–∞ –∏ –ø–∞–Ω–∫–∞. –Ø–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å–æ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –∞—Ä—Ç–∏—Å—Ç–æ–º, –±–æ–ª—å—à—É—é —á–∞—Å—Ç—å —Å—Ç—É–¥–∏–π–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å–µ–π –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç —Å–∞–º, –∞ –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ—Ä—Ç–∞—Ö –º—É–∑—ã–∫–∞–Ω—Ç–∞ —Å–æ–ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∂–¥–∞–µ—Ç –µ–≥–æ —Ä–æ–∫-–≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–∞.

–û–Ω –∏–≥—Ä–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ –∫–ª–∞–≤–∏—à–Ω—ã—Ö, –≥–∏—Ç–∞—Ä–µ, –±–∞—Å-–≥–∏—Ç–∞—Ä–µ –∏ —É–¥–∞—Ä–Ω–æ–π —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∫–µ. –í —Ä–∞–Ω–Ω–∏–µ –≥–æ–¥—ã –∏–≥—Ä–∞–ª –≤ –ø–∞–Ω–∫-—Ö–∞—Ä–¥–∫–æ—Ä-–≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–µ The Vatican Commandos, –Ω–æ –≤ 1989 —Å–º–µ–Ω–∏–ª –ø–∞–Ω–∫ –Ω–∞ —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—É—é –º—É–∑—ã–∫—É. –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –∞–ª—å–±–æ–º –ú–æ–±–∏ –≤—ã–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏–ª –≤ 1992 –≥–æ–¥—É (Moby), –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–ª 12 –ø–µ—Å–µ–Ω –≤ —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ. –ü–æ–∑–¥–Ω–µ–µ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –∞–ª—å–±–æ–º –±—ã–ª –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∏–∑–¥–∞–Ω –ø–æ–¥ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–º –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º (The Story So Far).

–°—Ä–µ–¥–∏ –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –ø–µ—Å–µ–Ω –ú–æ–±–∏: ¬´Extreme ways¬ª (–ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–∞ —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫—É—é –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤ —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º–µ ¬´–ò–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è –ë–æ—Ä–Ω–∞¬ª), ¬´Go¬ª, ¬´Porcelain¬ª, ¬´Why Does My Heart Feel So Bad?¬ª, ¬´Natural Blues¬ª, ¬´Lift Me Up¬ª. –û–Ω —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –≤—ã–ø—É—Å–∫–∞–ª –∞–ª—å–±–æ–º—ã –ø–æ–¥ –ø—Å–µ–≤–¥–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–º–∏ Voodoo Child, Schaumgummi, Barracuda, UHF, The Brotherhood, DJ Cake, Lopez –∏ Brainstorm/Mindstorm. –í –æ–±—â–µ–π —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–æ –≤—Å–µ–º—É –º–∏—Ä—É –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–Ω–æ –æ–∫–æ–ª–æ 20 –º–∏–ª–ª–∏–æ–Ω–æ–≤ –∫–æ–ø–∏–π –µ–≥–æ –∞–ª—å–±–æ–º–æ–≤, —Å–∏–Ω–≥–ª–æ–≤, —Å–±–æ—Ä–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤.
theaudiodb.name: Moby
